medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noted blurred vision in her right eye 1 week prior to admission, which was accompanied by severe throbbing pain behind the right eye and redness. Pain resolved spontaneously but was followed by pain in the right lower quadrant radiating to the groin. The patient reported darkening urine color over the next several days. She experienced colicky pain in the left lower quadrant and flank one day before admission, followed by decreased urine output. Two weeks earlier, she had an influenza-like illness lasting 2 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of oxycodone addiction, currently on methadone; reported one occasion of heroin use 1 month prior to admission.
medical_history.social_history: Single, owns a cat, no history of foreign travel.
